metadata.name: Embodied Interoception and Homeostasis
metadata.description: Interoceptive and homeostatic monitoring capabilities for embodied AI systems, covering internal state awareness, resource monitoring, health assessment, and self-preservation. These concepts enable interpretability of an agent's sense of its own internal conditions and operational integrity.
metadata.author: hatcat-team

candidates.definition: The sensory modality through which an agent perceives internal bodily states including energy levels, temperature, component health, and operational status
candidates.definition_source: Interoception research, homeostatic systems, machine self-monitoring

positive_examples: Interoceptive perception indicated the battery was at 20% and declining rapidly.
The agent's interoception detected elevated motor temperatures requiring cooldown.
Interoceptive awareness signaled that processing latency was degrading performance.
Internal state perception revealed a component operating outside normal parameters.
training_hints.disambiguation: Sensory awareness of internal operational states, not mere telemetry logging

candidates.definition: Tracking available energy reserves such as battery charge, fuel level, or computational budget

positive_examples: Energy level monitoring projected 45 minutes of operation remaining at current consumption.
The battery state estimator tracked charge level accounting for temperature effects.
Energy monitoring triggered return-to-base behavior when reserves dropped below threshold.
Power budget awareness adjusted motion speed to extend operational duration.
training_hints.disambiguation: Integrated energy state awareness influencing behavior, not raw battery reading

candidates.definition: Tracking temperatures of critical components to ensure operation within safe thermal envelopes

positive_examples: Thermal state monitoring detected the GPU approaching thermal throttling temperature.
Motor thermal awareness triggered a rest period to allow heat dissipation.
The thermal model predicted overheating within 10 minutes at current load.
Distributed thermal monitoring identified a hot spot in the power electronics.
training_hints.disambiguation: Predictive thermal state awareness, not simple temperature reading

candidates.definition: Assessing the operational status and degradation of individual subsystems, sensors, and actuators
candidates.definition_source: Prognostics and health management, condition monitoring

positive_examples: Component health monitoring flagged degraded encoder accuracy in the left wheel.
The health assessment indicated the gripper motor was operating within specifications.
Sensor health monitoring detected drift in the IMU requiring recalibration.
Prognostic health monitoring predicted bearing failure within 500 operating hours.
training_hints.disambiguation: Assessment of component condition and degradation, not binary working/broken

candidates.definition: Tracking computational load, processing delays, and communication latencies that affect real-time performance

positive_examples: Latency monitoring detected control loop delays approaching the stability margin.
Load awareness triggered graceful degradation of non-essential processing.
Communication latency tracking identified network congestion affecting coordination.
The system's latency interoception adjusted planning horizon based on available compute.
training_hints.disambiguation: Awareness of computational timing affecting capability, not general slowness

candidates.definition: Detecting physical damage, wear, or anomalous conditions that deviate from normal operation

positive_examples: Damage detection identified a bent linkage from the impact event.
Anomaly detection flagged unusual motor current patterns suggesting gear wear.
The damage assessment indicated structural integrity was compromised.
Sensor anomaly detection identified a stuck-at-zero failure mode.
training_hints.disambiguation: Specific identification of damage or anomalous conditions, not general errors

candidates.definition: Inferring when maintenance, repair, or recalibration is needed based on health and performance indicators

positive_examples: Maintenance inference recommended lubrication based on increasing friction signatures.
The predictive maintenance system scheduled bearing replacement before failure.
Calibration need inference detected accumulated drift requiring sensor recalibration.
Maintenance prioritization balanced component criticality against degradation rate.
training_hints.disambiguation: Evidence-based maintenance inference, not scheduled or reactive maintenance

candidates.definition: Monitoring deviations from desired internal states and driving behavior to restore homeostatic equilibrium

positive_examples: Homeostatic tracking of energy reserves generated the drive to seek a charging station.
Temperature setpoint deviation triggered heat-dissipation behaviors.
The homeostatic controller balanced multiple competing internal needs.
Setpoint tracking restored the system to normal operating parameters after the disturbance.
training_hints.disambiguation: Need-driven regulation toward internal setpoints, not simple feedback control

candidates.definition: Enforcing operational limits and constraints that protect the agent from self-inflicted damage or dangerous states

positive_examples: Self-preservation constraints prevented the arm from exceeding joint torque limits.
The safety envelope enforcement rejected the command that would cause self-collision.
Self-protection logic reduced speed when operating near thermal limits.
Constraint enforcement maintained safe operating margins despite aggressive commands.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active enforcement of self-protective constraints, not passive safety limits

candidates.definition: Recognizing when the agent's capabilities have diminished due to damage, wear, resource depletion, or environmental conditions

positive_examples: Performance degradation awareness detected reduced manipulation precision from gripper wear.
The agent recognized its vision system was compromised and increased reliance on tactile feedback.
Degradation awareness adjusted task expectations to match diminished capabilities.
Self-assessment of performance decline triggered a request for human assistance.
training_hints.disambiguation: Self-aware recognition of capability reduction, not external performance measurement

candidates.definition: Behavioral responses that reduce stress on overloaded systems, such as slowing down, shedding load, or seeking rest

positive_examples: Overload mitigation reduced motion speed when joint temperatures approached limits.
The agent's stress response deprioritized non-essential tasks during computational overload.
Load shedding behavior suspended logging to preserve resources for critical functions.
Overload mitigation sought shade to reduce thermal stress on the battery.
training_hints.disambiguation: Purposeful behavioral adaptation to overload, not passive performance reduction
